alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 11:56AM EST until January 06 at 10:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. A light ice accumulation is also possible. * WHERE...Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...Through 10 PM EST this Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially in the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow could fall heavily at times between Noon and 5 pm, then will taper off to light snow or freezing drizzle later in the evening. Snowfall rates as high as 2 inches per hour this afternoon. Localized snow totals could reach 8 inches. Additional light snow will occur later tonight and last into Sunday.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel as significant winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
